http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv-community.gif http://www.lsoft.com/images/listserv_small.gif ADAF List ADAF List Archives https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?RSS&L=ADAF&v=ATOM1.0
This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=ADAF.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-02-09T09:57:29Z Aled Pugh 2015-02-09T09:47:09+00:00 2015-02-09T09:47:09+00:00 Recruitment Projections https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;d824de88.1502 Hi all,<br><br>I'm in the process of reviewing how we use current in-cycle application data to project forward and predict our new intake for Sept. I'd be interested to hear your thoughts on the extent to which you undertake such activity and how you approach it?<br><br>I'm assuming that most of you would use trends from previous years (although these can be volatile) and apply to current data but I'd be interested to know at what level you conduct the analysis, what different variables you consider and how (if at all) you attempt to reflect in-cycle changes. [...] Granger, Jessica 2015-01-08T12:25:31+00:00 2015-01-08T12:25:31+00:00 Recruiting for Data Analysis Officer in King's Admissions Office https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;cc35393d.1501 Dear all,<br><br>King's Admissions Office is currently looking to recruit for a Data Analysis Officer at Grade 5 (\ufffd\ufffd27,057 to \ufffd\ufffd31,342 Grade 5).<br><br>It's a challenging and ever-evolving role with a great bunch of people, currently based at London Bridge.<br><br>If you or anyone you know would be interested, please see the link below for details, and note that the closing date is 12th January. [...] Amy Butterworth 2014-10-15T17:14:59+01:00 2014-10-15T17:14:59+01:00 Fwd: Calculating how many offers to make - how do you do it? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;b678b313.1410 Hi fellow analysts,<br><br>Way back in July I sent this email to the list about a new method for<br>calculating UG offer targets. We've now come up with a new method which<br>(fingers crossed) we hope will work. However, I've now been asked to look<br>into the possibility of calculating set offer targets for postgraduate<br>taught programmes. I'm a bit stumped about this since Bristol's PG<br>admissions process and the PG environment in general is so very different<br>to UG. I was wondering if anyone had any advice and guidance? Does anyone<br>have any experience of calculating offer targets for [...] Cooper, Rob 2014-09-17T09:06:27+00:00 2014-09-17T09:06:27+00:00 Re: UCAS data group https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;7936abb9.1409 Good morning,<br><br>I'm not sure if this group is still active but I thought I'd give it a go.<br><br>This may possibly seem like an obvious question, but I was wondering if anyone knew why several of the UCAS reference tables contain two sets of the same data - one is usually numeric and the other alphabetical. Most obvious examples of this are the disabilities table and the residential category table, which pretty much have the same values duplicated. [...] Amy Butterworth 2014-07-16T17:13:15+01:00 2014-07-16T17:13:15+01:00 Calculating how many offers to make - how do you do it? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;899222b0.1407 Hi all,<br><br>I have been reviewing how we calculate our UG offer targets here at the<br>University of Bristol. At the moment, we calculate a set offer target based<br>on historical conversion of conditional firm and conditional insurance<br>offer holders to UF and the number of places to fill (eg, if you have 100<br>places to fill in Chemistry and your CF/CI to UF conversion rate is 10% you<br>need to make 1000 conditional offers). However, given that conversion rates<br>have been pretty unstable for the past few years, we are thinking of<br>setting some upper and lower bounds - [...] Clare Foyle 2014-06-19T11:00:57+01:00 2014-06-19T11:00:57+01:00 Re: Predicted grades 40 points higher than Actual Grades? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;f4ea063f.1406 Hi Jan, I guess we have uncertainty at both ends of the process - grade inflation at the predicted UCAS tariff points per applicant stage and also with the marking which is likely to continue to be much more stringent again this year. I wonder if there is a consistent points inflation across the board if this is more prevalent with certain sorts of applicants or applicants from certain schools or colleges. I'm presuming there is a difference between those predicted ABB+ and otherwise, those with A-Levels and those with other entry qualifications for example. I'd be really interested to [...] Jan Howard 2014-06-19T10:43:21+01:00 2014-06-19T10:43:21+01:00 Predicted grades 40 points higher than Actual Grades? https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;dceaa7ae.1406 Has anyone noticed whether predicted grades have crept up from being 40 points too high on average to being nearer to 60 points too high?<br><br>I'm still assuming I'll have to adjust the predicted grades and lower them by 40 points but is there any evidence that I should reduce by 50 or 60? [...] Robert M Hall 2014-04-22T13:00:52+00:00 2014-04-22T13:00:52+00:00 Re: Prizes for an international survey https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;b7aa29d7.1404 Hi Paul,<br><br>I'm ignorant of bitcoin but from an initial search it looks like the sort of thing we're looking for.<br><br>Thanks very much,<br><br>Rob<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: Admissions Data Analysts Forum [mailto:ADAF@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Paul Kevill<br>Sent: 22 April 2014 13:32<br>To: ADAF@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Re: Prizes for an international survey<br><br>Howsabout a bitcoin! Paul Kevill 2014-04-22T13:31:37+01:00 2014-04-22T13:31:37+01:00 Re: Prizes for an international survey https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;4aa780a5.1404 Howsabout a bitcoin! Robert Hall 2014-04-22T10:49:38+01:00 2014-04-22T10:49:38+01:00 Prizes for an international survey https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;3a1441eb.1404 Hi,<br><br>My mind is a blank on this one so I could do with a bit of help.<br><br>We send out surveys to groups of applicants and usually offer some sort of a prize such as Amazon vouchers or book vouchers. This works fine if applicants live in the UK, but we also want to get feedback from international applicants. Can anyone suggest a suitable prize that would work as an incentive to complete the survey, wherever you live? The best I've come up with is to arrange for a bank transfer, but I'm sure there must be something better. [...] Jo Hamilton 2014-04-14T12:47:32+01:00 2014-04-14T12:47:32+01:00 Re: UCAS data group https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;6ab304da.1404 Hi All,<br><br>I agree with Amy and Jess, I think there is a lot we could get out of ADAF.<br><br>For instance, we could ask UCAS to attend our next forum meeting. We could come up with our wish list of what we'd like to see from UCAS and then receive UCAS's response on these and an update on their progression. I personally feel that as a large group we have more clout and will be more representative. [...] Amy Butterworth 2014-04-14T11:48:09+01:00 2014-04-14T11:48:09+01:00 Re: UCAS data group https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;949f6290.1404 Hi all,<br><br>I agree with Jessica, there is still value for this group even in a<br>competitive environment. Since the group is open to anyone working in<br>Admissions data in HE we can't be said to have a competitive advantage!<br>Even if we feel we can't discuss actual data points there is still value in<br>disseminating best practice, useful external sources of data etc. [...] Granger, Jessica 2014-04-14T09:12:39+00:00 2014-04-14T09:12:39+00:00 Re: UCAS data group https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;ac585fd9.1404 Morning,<br><br>I think there is still value here - if HESA can offer guidance and a forum for Planners I see no automatic challenge in for something for Admissions Data analysis based on supporting professionalism and development in the sector.<br><br>Re: UCAS note that this won't cover all areas (PG, non degree etc), and it's sometimes the 'joining up' and juggling of all this data which can prove the challenge. [...] Clare Foyle 2014-04-10T16:08:05+01:00 2014-04-10T16:08:05+01:00 Re: UCAS data group https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;d41d71cc.1404 Hi Rob and the ADAF group, I'd totally agree with the limitations you're feeling about a group like ADAF which I think is one of the reasons it hasn't generated much discussion so far. The competitive nature of the sector does make it difficult to collaborate, particularly when we are working in such a sensitive area. I'd really appreciate all your views on how best we can take it forward as I too believe it would be useful. Do we still agree that a formal/informal conference or meeting would still be useful? Could you either contact me on the list [...] Robert Hall 2014-04-10T15:48:02+01:00 2014-04-10T15:48:02+01:00 Re: UCAS data group https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;d13f4834.1404 Dear David,<br><br>I was thinking of putting myself forward for the UCAS group this time round.<br><br>I wasn't sure if ADAF was still running actively and that's one of the reasons why I thought the UCAS group would be useful. Given the phased removal of SNC, and the competitive nature of the sector now, I wonder how much we are able to collaborate on in a group like ADAF? I think it would still be useful but I haven't really thought it through. [...] Granger, Jessica 2014-04-10T13:51:56+00:00 2014-04-10T13:51:56+00:00 Re: UCAS data group https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;ed3b9c13.1404 We\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdre not but as you suggest Dave it sounds like a good idea to link up.<br><br>Also if anyone is not aware/involved in SROC, may want to see the sessions they have on next week on HE data governance, data breaches, dashboards etc or ask Student Records colleagues to feed back : [...] Dave Kirk 2014-04-10T13:02:59+00:00 2014-04-10T13:02:59+00:00 UCAS data group https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=ADAF;9e5c9dde.1404 Dear all,<br><br>Does anyone from this group get involved in the UCAS data group? Is this something that this group may want to feed into?<br><br>Thanks<br>Dave<br><br>UCAS Data Group \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd invitation for new members<br><br>The UCAS Data Group is looking for up to 10 new people to join in 2014.<br><br>The Data Group will provide a forum for UCAS and providers to discuss strategic and cross-cutting operational issues related to data. It aims to improve the quality of UCAS\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd data assets and the effectiveness and efficiency of data collection, management and exchange between UCAS, providers and the wider HE [...]
